page.title: 17MINSTERLEY EISTEDDFOD
page.content: Every year in{March}there is an Eisteddfod held in the{Parish Hall.It goes on from morning until late at night. There are{choirs, solo singers, {recitations, poetry & short story competitions.Instrumentalists play {harps, violins, piano, flute & 'cello. In the morning the children perform. The Rev. Howell introduces us.There are individuals & school {choirs,}including the choir from Minsterley School. The six judges sit in the middle of the audience at a long table.There is one judge for each competition.It is frightening to stand on the stage & face all the people watching.The Judges afterwards read all the marks of the competitors & say what was good & what was bad about each performance.Adults perform later. The winners get{cups & rosettes.
